snippet: In the midst of a separate scandal relating to the television host Jimmy Savile, the BBC is disciplining news personnel over reporting that wrongly implicated a Conservative Party politician.
abstract: British Broadcasting Corp says it will begin disciplinary action against unidentified news personnel linked to scandal over child abuse report that wrongly implicated Conservative Party treasurer Alistair McAlpine; action comes three weeks after network became embroiled in separate abuse scandal involving television host Jimmy Savile.

byline.original: By ALAN COWELL and JOHN F. BURNS

lead_paragraph: In the midst of a separate scandal relating to the television host Jimmy Savile, the BBC is disciplining news personnel over reporting that wrongly implicated a Conservative Party politician.

headline.seo: BBC Begins Disciplinary Action Over Child-Sex Report
headline.main: BBC Staff Faces Discipline for False Child-Sex Report
headline.print_headline: BBC Staff Faces Discipline For False Child-Sex Report
